item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Pippin. I make games. I’m on Twitter, Instagram, Email, and I even have an incredibly unreliable Newsletter. I’m an Associate Professor in the Department of Design and Computation Arts at Concordia University in Montréal. I’m the associate director of the Technoculture, Art, and Games (TAG) Research Centre, part of the Milieux Institute for Arts, Culture, and Technology. I teach or have taught creative programming, game design and development, game analysis and criticism, and internet/web-based art.

item.title: Les grands classiques de l’horreur en mots cachés
item.description: Les grands classiques de l’horreur en mots cachés by Jonathan Lessard and Pippin Barr Retellings of the stories of *Dracula*, *Frankenstein*, and more in the form of "word find" puzzles. Each chapter of each book is represented as a word find with specific key words plus a secret message at the end! In French. Created with Jonathan Lessard. item.title: Let's Play Permadeath Speedrun
item.description: Let's Play Permadeath Speedrun A permadeath speedrun is a playing of a game in which you try to die as quickly as possible. It's a way of refocusing your attention on a game's affordances and systems of progression as well as its representation and handling of death. Season 1 (2014) Featuring: VVVVVV, SUPERHOT, Super Hexagon, Jostle Parent, Hotline Miami, Helix, Desert Golf, GIRP, Sausage!! Sausage!! Sausage!!, Pitfall!, ADVENT, The Graveyard, Kaizo Mario, Super Punch-Out!

item.title: Shooting
item.description: Shooting Shooting is a video series in which I playing videogames that include gun violence and shoot the same dead person (or creature) over and over again until I run out of ammunition. For the moment it only includes the initial video drawn from *Half-Life*, but I still have dreams of expanding it over time. Shooting, season 1 Featuring: Half-Life

item.title: The Stuff Games Are Made Of
item.description: The Stuff Games Are Made Of by Pippin Barr I’m in the process of writing a book for The MIT Press about experimental game design seen through the perspective of the materials of game creation. I’ve been writing about everything from computation to user interfaces to time. All going to plan, the book should be available in the first half of 2023.

item.title: How to Play a Video Game
item.description: How To Play a Video Game by Pippin Barr My 2010 book exploring the world of videogames from the perspective of a creative player and asking what makes them so interesting outside the most obvious factors such as engagement, immersion, and so on. Each chapter is a deep dive into a specific idea such as genre, control systems, avatars, and more. Links How To Play a Video Game on the Awa Press website
